uno-cmd-help: Run `{0}uno help` for information about the set of rules used here.
uno-start-desc: Start (or vote to start) the game of UNO!
uno-help-desc: Get information about the version of UNO this bot lets you play.
uno-help:
In this version, every time you empty your hand you get 10 points.
Once your hand runs out, you refill it with 7 more cards to continue playing.
When the deck runs out, you still continue to play until nobody can make a move.
Once that has happened, any cards still in your hand are subtracted from your points, where non-number cards are worth 10.
hand: On the left is the top card of the discard pile; on the right is your current hand. You have **{0}** points.
card-numbers:
The leftmost card in your hand (not the discard card, which is all the way on the left) is numbered 1, the second-to-left 2, and so on.
If you like, you can also do the same from the right using negative numbers - rightmost card is -1, second-to-right is -2, and so on.
waiting-for-card: Send the number of a card in your hand (e.g. 7 or -3) to play it.
choose-color: Click the heart with the color you want to set the game to.
next-turn: {0} drew and couldn't play, so it is now {1}'s turn.
empty: {0} has emptied their hand and gained 10 points!
uno-timed-out: You didn't play a card for {0} seconds! You have been removed from the game.
cannot-turn: After drawing a card, you still can't play any cards. Your turn has been skipped.
card-played: Below is the card that {0} played:
cards-drawn: Here are the cards you drew:
